knowledge.question: In the above Assembly code, what's contained in the leftmost byte of the rax register?
choices: a copy of the cl contents
explanation: Incorrect: Moving a smaller register (c1) to a larger register (rax) will result in the cl contents being placed in the rightmost bits
Incorrect: The movzs puts all zeros in unfilled bits therefore there will be no residual data
Correct: The movzx puts zeros in all unfilled bits from a mov command, because cl only has 8 bits, the leftmost 56 bits (7 bytes) are filled with zeros
Incorrect: this mov command moves contents of a register not an address
